greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Polylogarithm li(-n,-1/4) multiplied by (5^(n+1))/4.
comment: See the sequence A212846 which describes the general case of li(-n,-p/q). This sequence is obtained for p=1,q=4.
link: Stanislav Sykora, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..100
formula: See formula in A212846, setting p=1,q=4
The compositional inverse (A(-x) - 1)^(-1) = x + 3*x^2/2 + 13*x^3/3 + 51*x^4/4 + 205*x^5/5 + ... is the logarithmic generating function for A015521.
G.f.: 1/Q(0), where Q(k) = 1 + x*(k+1)/( 1 - 4*x*(k+1)/Q(k+1) ); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Dec 17 2013
results.author: _Stanislav Sykora_, Jun 06 2012
